name: gelatinous mass
description: An amorphous mass that can be shaped for various tasks. The translucent green pseudopods shift constantly and seem to respond to your intentions. It feels squishy yet sturdy when molded. You believe you can split it apart with enough force.

use_action.msg: You fumble as the blob starts to multiply rapidly!

name: blob programmer
description: This is a queen meshed together with a gelectrode, and a few electronics which it has ingested and assimilated. After much work it is now ready to interact with other complex blob constructions so you can program or teach them. The way it looks at you is sometimes unnerving.

name: puffer chemical factory
description: You've had the possibly genius, or possibly insane idea to combine the three puffer blob types into a chemical factory, using the blob programmer to set it up correctly. The result is able to turn yeast and various base chemicals into useful substances.

name: gelectrode hotplate
description: A couple of gelectrodes you grafted together with some blob globs. It works to generate heat for cooking and chemistry.

name: gel headlamp (off)
description: This is a gelectrode which you have crafted to be a wearable source of light. It goes on your head.

use_action.need_charges_msg: The gel headlamp is out of blob feed

use_action.msg: You turn off your gel headlamp.

name: slime jackhammer
description: It's a blob that's been taught to mimic a jackhammer. When you squeeze the handles the end thrusts like a jackhammer. You swear you can hear it squee with joy every time you use it.

A blob-based repair kit consisting of a gloople combined with various slime scraps. The gloople acts as both needle and thread, intelligently weaving slime materials back together. Perfect for repairing slime suits, armor, and other blob-based equipment.

name: slime butchering rack
description: A portable blob-based butchering rack. When deployed, it provides an excellent surface for butchering and hanging carcasses. The blob intelligently shapes itself to hold your work steady.
